channel.title: Blogs on Jessica Jagdeo ESM 244 Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Jessica Jagdeo ESM 244 Blog

item.title: Assessment of Santa Ynez River Water Quality
item.description: Santa Ynez Water Quality Historical Data Data only goes back to 1998 Turbidity units: NTU TSS and TDS units: mg/L santa_ynez_water_quality_raw <- read_csv("RAW_santa_ynez_water_quality.csv") santa_ynez_water_quality <- santa_ynez_water_quality_raw %>% select(OrganizationFormalName, ActivityStartDate, MonitoringLocationIdentifier, CharacteristicName, ResultSampleFractionText, ResultMeasureValue, "ResultMeasure/MeasureUnitCode") %>% # Selecting only relevant columns filter(CharacteristicName == "Total dissolved solids"| CharacteristicName == "Turbidity" | CharacteristicName == "Total suspended solids") %>% separate(ActivityStartDate, sep = "-", into = c("year", "month", "day")) %>% group_by(year, month, CharacteristicName) %>% summarize(value = sum(ResultMeasureValue)) santa_ynez_water_quality$date <- as.

item.title: Bonanza Creek Snowshow Hare Examination
item.description: From 1999 to 2017, physical characteristics of snowshoe hares were observed and recorded in the Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest within Alaska (Kielland et al.Â 2017). This project utilizes the data obtained from this study to visualize the weight and sex of the observed snowshoe hares. In addition, this project explores the summary statistics of the recorded weights for both female and male snowshoe hares.

item.title: Examining Runoff Ratio in Santa Cruz Creek Sub-basin
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(readxl) library(lubridate) library(janitor) library(ggthemes) library(zoo) library(magrittr) library(gghighlight) library(tsibble) library(paletteer) Santa Cruz Gauge Observed Flow # Read in SC observed flow data sc_usgs_flow <- read_csv("sc_creek_clean.csv") sc_usgs_flow$dis_cfs <- as.numeric(as.character(sc_usgs_flow$dis_cfs)) # Convert date from character to date sc_usgs_flow$date <- as.Date(sc_usgs_flow$date, "%m/%d/%Y") # Create column for daily inflow in cumecs (cfs to cubic meters per second (cumecs)) sc_flow_cumecs <- sc_usgs_flow %>% mutate(dis_cumecs = (dis_cfs*0.03)) %>% select(date, dis_cumecs) Surface runoff calculation Divide aggregated monthly discharge by area (km) to obtain to meters of runoff.

item.title: Gibraltar Reservoir Capacity
item.description: # Load in necessary packages library(tidyverse) library(readxl) library(janitor) library(lubridate) library(gghighlight) library(kableExtra) library(ggplot2) library(ggthemes) library(here) # Load in the data and clean gibraltar_storage <- read_excel("RAW_Gibraltar_Storage_Elevation_2001_2019.xls") %>% rename("date" = "36892", "capacity" = "3182", "total_capacity" = "7500") %>% mutate(capacity_m3 = (capacity*1233.48)) Water storage in Gibraltar Reservoir gibraltar_cap_plot <- ggplot(gibraltar_storage, aes(x = date, y = capacity)) + geom_area(color = "darkblue", fill = "darkblue") + # creates area rather than bars theme_classic() + labs(x = "Year", y = "Water (acre-feet)" ) + ggtitle("Gibraltar Water Stored (2001 - 2018)\n") + theme(plot.
